lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Delta.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Delta.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
#### Delta ChatBot is an app to assist you with your task management needs!
Here are the tasks in your list:
Adds a Todo task in your list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Adds a Deadline task in your list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds a Event task in your list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Marks a task in your list as done.
Nice! I've marked this task as done!
Unmarks a task in your list (i.e. mark the task as not done yet).
Nice! I've marked this task as not done yet!
Deletes a task from the list.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Finds a task in the list using keywords.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Edits a task in your list.
Possible task attributes for each task:
Exits the chatbot after you are done. Tasks will be kept in memory and rebooted upon start up.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
* Delta is a chatbot to assist in task management.
* @param filePath Relative file path of save file for Delta ChatBot.
* Runs main logic of Delta ChatBot for CLI.
* Serves as main entry point of Delta ChatBot for CLI.
* Returns Delta ChatBot response for a user input given by JavaFX UI.
* Concrete subclass of Command abstract class.
* Adds given task into stored list.
* @param task Task to be added into list.
* Returns that AddCommand is not the exit command.
* @param tasks List containing all current tasks.
* @param ui User Interfacing object to print task added message.
* @param storage Storage object to save list after task added.
* @throws DeltaException If list unable to be saved.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DeltaException {
assert tasks.getTasks().contains(task) : "Task not added into TaskList";
String message = "Got it. I've added this task:\n"
+ "Now you have " + tasks.getSize() + " task" + (tasks.getSize() > 1 ? "s" : "") + " in the list.";
* Includes method to determine if current command is the exiting command,

* @param storage Storage object to save tasklist after each command.
* @throws DeltaException If error in executing specific commands.
public abstract String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DeltaException;

Add, Delete, Edit, Exit, Find, Mark, Print, Unmark
* Concrete subclass of Command abstract class.
* Deletes specific task from stored list.

* @param storage Storage object to save list after task deleted.
* @throws DeltaException If problem deleting task from list or list unable to be saved.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DeltaException {
String message = "Noted. I've removed this task:\n"
+ "Now you have " + tasks.getSize() + " task" + (tasks.getSize() > 1 ? "s" : "") + " in the list.";
